meanings.definition: The state or quality of being young.
meanings.sent1: Her youngnesses shone through in her playful demeanor.
meanings.sent2: The youngnesses of the puppies was evident in their boundless energy.
meanings.sent3: Despite her old age, she still had a hint of youngnesses in her eyes.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with the youngnesses of spring, vibrant and fresh.
meanings.sent5: The youngnesses of the students brought a sense of vitality to the classroom.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being youthful or not fully mature.
meanings.sent1: His youngnesses made him eager to explore the world around him.
meanings.sent2: The youngnesses of the new recruits showed in their enthusiasm for the job.
meanings.sent3: The youngnesses of the kitten was evident in its clumsy yet adorable movements.
meanings.sent4: The youngnesses of the tree was reflected in its small size and delicate leaves.
meanings.sent5: The youngnesses of the team brought a sense of innovation to the project.
